pr_title: DHFPROD-3922: incorporate loadData options when running ingest

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
List<String> roles = new LinkedList<>();
Set<String> roles = new HashSet<>();
timeline.author: hao1st

replies.bodyText: Refactored to add a canUserUpdate property artifactType info, so checking the roles is no longer necessary.
replies.author: ryanjdew

replies.bodyText: Refactored to add a canUserUpdate property artifactTypeInfo class, so checking the roles is no longer necessary.
replies.author: ryanjdew

timeline.bodyText:
put the following right after for loop
if (roles.contains(typeInfo.getUpdateRole()) { continue; }
timeline.bodyHTML:
put the following right after for loop
if (roles.contains(typeInfo.getUpdateRole()) { continue; }
timeline.author: hao1st

replies.bodyText: I was thinking - first check to see if the artifactPath doesn't exist, and if not, log an info message of "Artifact directory (directory) does not exist, so will not load any artifacts from it". Then check to see if the user has the update role, and if so, load the artifacts; if not, log an info message stating "User is not permitted to update artifacts of type (type), so will not load any artifacts of that type".
replies.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Changed to use continue calls and added more specific logging as to why an artifact type may not be loaded.
replies.author: ryanjdew

timeline.body: We shouldn't need this code - Jackson will automatically convert an ObjectNode into a POJO based on naming conventions. You can do objectMapper.readerFor(Class).readValue(jsonObject).
timeline.bodyText: We shouldn't need this code - Jackson will automatically convert an ObjectNode into a POJO based on naming conventions. You can do objectMapper.readerFor(Class).readValue(jsonObject).
timeline.bodyHTML: We shouldn't need this code - Jackson will automatically convert an ObjectNode into a POJO based on naming conventions. You can do objectMapper.readerFor(Class).readValue(jsonObject).
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.body:
I think this is a good method to add to HubProject. I think HubProject should be aware of an ArtifactTypeInfo, and thus have a method of:

    Path getArtifactTypePath(ArtifactTypeInfo)

timeline.body: What's the benefit of saving this state in the class? Are there use cases where we may invoke multiple methods on an instance of this class for the same user?
timeline.bodyText: What's the benefit of saving this state in the class? Are there use cases where we may invoke multiple methods on an instance of this class for the same user?
timeline.bodyHTML: What's the benefit of saving this state in the class? Are there use cases where we may invoke multiple methods on an instance of this class for the same user?
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: No longer keeping the state. With the change to deliberately state whether the current user can update an artifact type, we want to ensure that information is current anyway.
replies.author: ryanjdew

timeline.body: I think "Component" can be removed, right? I'd rather see the tests that are autowiring this in just instantiate an instance when it needs it (there are only 3 of them).

timeline.body: How about making this a protected method? Then you can easily unit test the various branches in this method without having to connect to ML or setup a test flow.
timeline.bodyText: How about making this a protected method? Then you can easily unit test the various branches in this method without having to connect to ML or setup a test flow.
timeline.bodyHTML: How about making this a protected method? Then you can easily unit test the various branches in this method without having to connect to ML or setup a test flow.
timeline.author: rjrudin
